AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Imperial
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: human
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: The Human race (Homo sapiens), also known as humanity, Mankind or Man, is that collection of factions comprised of humanity, the most dominant intelligent race in the Milky Way Galaxy in the late 41st Millennium AD.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Imperial_ELT
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: human
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: The Human race (Homo sapiens), also known as humanity, Mankind or Man, is that collection of factions comprised of humanity, the most dominant intelligent race in the Milky Way Galaxy in the late 41st Millennium AD.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Mechanicus
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: human
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets. While still baseline humans, members of the Cult Mechanicus have usually undergone many cybernetic upgrades.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Imperial_Astartes
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: astartes
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: A Space Marines or Adeptus Astartes, foremost amongst the defenders of humanity, the greatest of the Emperor of Mankind's warriors. They are barely human at all, but superhuman; having been made superior in all respects to a normal man by a harsh regime of genetic modification, psycho-conditioning and rigorous training. Space Marines are untouched by plague or any natural disease and can suffer wounds that would kill a lesser being several times over, and live to fight again.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Abhuman_Ogryn
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: Ogryn
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: The dim-witted human sub-species called Ogryns (Homo sapiens gigantus) evolved on high-gravity, low-temperature prison planets. They are huge and unusually stupid for a human subrace, but unquestionably loyal to the Imperium once introduced to the faith of the Imperial Cult. Ogryns are used as the Imperial Guard's shock troops, and for this role, they are commonly outfitted with the Ripper Gun. The Ripper Gun is a weapon simple enough for them to operate, although some feral Ogryn cannot even fathom this device. Ogryn are also frequently used as bodyguards by Imperial Commanders.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Abhuman_Ratling
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: ratling
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: Ratlings (Homo sapiens minimus) are small, loud, hungry and lecherous Abhumans who often serve as snipers in the Astra Militarum, a role at which they excel. Ratlings also serve as cooks for Imperial Guard regiments, a skill they no doubt learned in order to feed their own seemingly bottomless stomachs; and they also have kleptomaniac tendencies, as Commissars report petty theft and illegal gambling rings increase substantially when Ratlings are attached to a platoon, company or regiment.

AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.Name: Abhuman_Beastman
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.label: beastman
AlienRace.ThingDef_AlienRace.description: Beastmen (Homo sapiens variatus) are horned, hoofed, and quite hairy Abhumans who appear like nothing so much as humanoid goats or rams. They were formerly recruited for the Imperial Army and later the Astra Militarum, where they used their bloodlust to fight for the Emperor and atone for the sin of being born as mutants. They were led by other Beastmen called Packmasters.
